intro: Macropanax serratifolius, commonly known as the serrated-leaf macropanax, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife.
